channel.title: Linux on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Configuration (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about how to configure linux.

item.title: Environmental Variables (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about the use of environmental variables in linux.

item.title: Files
item.description: File and file permissions are core to the security model used by Linux systems.

item.title: Linux Tools
item.description: This page contains links to the Linux (and Unix) specific tools that I have discovered, and documented, as a part of my development journey.

item.title: Monitoring Tools (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about some linux specific monitoring tools.

item.title: sh - Shell Command Language
item.description: sh (or the Shell Command Language) is a programming language described by the POSIX standard. It has many implementations (ksh88, dash, …). bash can also be considered an implementation of sh.

item.title: System Information (Linux)
item.description: Examples of how you get information about your linux system and hardware.

item.title: systemd
item.description: Systemd is a suite of basic building blocks for a Linux system. It provides a system and service manager that runs as PID 1 and starts the rest of the system.
